channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report X-2023071229
item.description:
Report X-2023071229

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: PORTAGE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was found in a trailer during with a wet bottom and was taken to the hazmat cage where it was found to be rain damage on the box but also that the bottles inside were leaking from the lids. DescribePack: Hazmats were leaking from the lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ensure proper preparation for transport.

item.title: Report X-2023070920
item.description:
Report X-2023070920

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: SAGINAW
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found leaking by one of the van lines. We used proper PPE to remove the package from the area and placed it into a hazmat bin, we then took the hazmat and placed it under the ventilation hood in the hazmat cage because of the strong fumes that were coming from the contents. Upon inspection we found that both bottles had been leaking because the caps were not secured and tightened properly. One bottle was more than halfway empty while that other bottle had only leaked a small amount of liquid. DescribePack: The caps were not secured or tightened properly leading to both bottles leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We placed the package into a Hazmat bin and none of the liquid contents got anywhere besides in the box and packing materials.

item.title: Report X-2023070108
item.description:
Report X-2023070108

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-08
  • City: WYOMING

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOADER FOUND PACKAGE LEAKING WITHIN TRAILER AND LET THEIR SUPERVISOR KNOW. A RESPONDER CLEANED AND CONTAINED THE SPILL. THEN BROUGHT IT BACK TO PSC WHERE THE SUPERVISOR CALLED IT INTO ADG AS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT.
